intro: Cratystylis conocephala, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cratystylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, delicate flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, damp environments such as rainforests. Cratystylis conocephala is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts to protect its habitat.
